message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IR, cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the challenges encountered when reproducing the work of others, collecting realistic data in the wild, and ensuring that our own work is reproducible in turn. It also presents findings based on a study investigating the limits of zero-interaction security (ZIS) - a novel concept, leveraging sensor data collected by Internet of Things (IoT) devices to pair or authenticate devices. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), followed by cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.SY (Systems and Control), cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), and cs.LG (Machine Learning).
